<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 195, 907, 210]]<|/det|>
9709/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 217, 907, 232]]<|/det|>
May/June 2012  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 239, 907, 254]]<|/det|>
1 hour 45 minutes  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 322, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 352, 828, 368]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 589, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 525]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 101, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 782, 94]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|4 - 2^{x}| = 10\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 125, 97, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 119, 153, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
Expand \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{(1 - 4x)}}\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\), simplifying the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 183, 153, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 667, 212]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\frac{1 + 2x}{\sqrt{(4 - 16x)}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 184, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 240, 96, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 238, 395, 259]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 265, 584, 285]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} - 3ax + 4a,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 293, 310]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 322, 151, 341]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 322, 603, 342]]<|/det|>
Given that \((x - 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\), find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 322, 920, 341]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 352, 148, 371]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 352, 341, 371]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) has this value,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 377, 185, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 377, 405, 396]]<|/det|>
factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 396]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 401, 185, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 401, 537, 420]]<|/det|>
find all the roots of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x^{2}) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 401, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 458, 96, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 450, 529, 477]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(u\) is defined by \(u = \frac{(1 + 2\mathrm{i})^2}{2 + \mathrm{i}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 492, 153, 510]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 491, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
Without using a calculator and showing your working, express \(u\) in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 508, 920, 527]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 537, 151, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 536, 910, 558]]<|/det|>
Sketch an Argand diagram showing the locus of the complex number \(z\) such that \(|z - u| = |u|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 553, 920, 572]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 599, 96, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 612, 714, 765]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 785, 356, 804]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 804, 581, 826]]<|/det|>
\[y = 8\sin {\frac{1}{2}}x - \tan {\frac{1}{2}}x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 829, 920, 864]]<|/det|>
for \(0 \leqslant x < \pi\). The \(x\)-coordinate of the maximum point is \(\alpha\) and the shaded region is enclosed by the curve and the lines \(x = \alpha\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 877, 153, 895]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 876, 306, 895]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\alpha = \frac{2}{3}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 876, 920, 895]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 907, 153, 925]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 907, 581, 925]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 907, 920, 925]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 490, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(3x^{2} - 4xy + y^{2} = 45.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 104, 154, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 559, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at the point (2, \(-3\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 135, 153, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 707, 153]]<|/det|>
Show that there are no points on the curve at which the gradient is 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 181, 96, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 181, 601, 201]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) are related by the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 207, 554, 243]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{6x\mathrm{e}^{3x}}{y^{2}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 250, 920, 285]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 2\) when \(x = 0\). Solve the differential equation and hence find the value of \(y\) when \(x = 0.5\), giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 266, 920, 285]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 325, 101, 345]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 316, 816, 358]]<|/det|>
The point \(P\) has coordinates \((-1, 4, 11)\) and the line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \left( \begin{array}{c}1 \\ 3 \\ -4 \end{array} \right) + \lambda \left( \begin{array}{c}2 \\ 1 \\ 3 \end{array} \right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 371, 154, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 371, 510, 389]]<|/det|>
Find the perpendicular distance from \(P\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 371, 920, 389]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 401, 148, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 401, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the plane which contains \(P\) and \(l\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\), where \(a\), \(b\), \(c\) and \(d\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 420, 920, 438]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 472, 96, 491]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 616, 502]]<|/det|>
By first expressing \(\frac{4x^{2} + 5x + 3}{2x^{2} + 5x + 2}\) in partial fractions, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 507, 623, 548]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{4}\frac{4x^{2} + 5x + 3}{2x^{2} + 5x + 2}\mathrm{d}x = 8 - \ln 9.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 586, 106, 605]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 586, 148, 605]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 586, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(2\tan 2x + 5\tan^{2}x = 0\). Denoting \(\tan x\) by \(t\), form an equation in \(t\) and hence show that either \(t = 0\) or \(t = \sqrt[3]{(t + 0.8)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 603, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 632, 151, 651]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 920, 666]]<|/det|>
It is given that there is exactly one real value of \(t\) satisfying the equation \(t = \sqrt[3]{(t + 0.8)}\). Verify by calculation that this value lies between 1.2 and 1.3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 650, 920, 668]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 680, 153, 698]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 680, 920, 714]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(t_{n + 1} = \sqrt[3]{(t_n + 0.8)}\) to find the value of \(t\) correct to 3 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 699, 920, 717]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 728, 151, 746]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 728, 792, 746]]<|/det|>
Using the values of \(t\) found in previous parts of the question, solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 753, 586, 772]]<|/det|>
\[2\tan 2x + 5\tan^2 x = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 781, 280, 799]]<|/det|>
for \(-\pi \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 781, 920, 799]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE
